parameters.name: CurrentPage
parameters.description: The page number of the page to return.

parameters.name: InstanceId
parameters.description:
The ID of the instance to which data in the column of the table belongs.

> You can call the [DescribeInstances](~~DescribeRules~~) operation to query the IDs of instances.

parameters.name: InstanceName
parameters.description: The name of the instance to which data in the column of the table belongs.

parameters.name: Lang
parameters.description:
The language of the content within the request and response. Default value: **zh_cn**. Valid values:

*   **zh_cn**: Chinese
*   **en_us**: English

parameters.name: ModelTagId
parameters.description:
The data tag.

*   101: personal sensitive information
*   102: personal information

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description:
The search keyword. Fuzzy match is supported.

For example, if you enter **test**, all columns whose names contain **test** are retrieved.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: The number of entries to return on each page.

parameters.name: ProductCode
parameters.description: The name of the service to which data in the column of the table belongs. Valid values include **MaxCompute, OSS, ADS, OTS, and RDS**.

parameters.name: ProductId
parameters.description:
The ID of the service to which the data object belongs. Valid values:

*   **1**: MaxCompute
*   **2**: Object Storage Service (OSS)
*   **3**: AnalyticDB for MySQL
*   **4**: Tablestore (OTS)
*   **5**: ApsaraDB RDS
*   **6**: self-managed database
*   **7**: PolarDB for Xscale (PolarDB-X)
*   **8**: PolarDB
*   **9**: AnalyticDB for PostgreSQL
*   **10**: ApsaraDB for OceanBase
*   **11**: ApsaraDB for MongoDB
*   **25**: ApsaraDB for Redis

parameters.name: RiskLevelId
parameters.description:
The sensitivity level of the sensitive data that hits the sensitive data detection rule. Valid values:

*   **1**: N/A
*   **2**: S1
*   **3**: S2
*   **4**: S3
*   **5**: S4

parameters.name: RuleId
parameters.description:
The ID of the sensitive data detection rule that data in the column of the table hits.

> You can call the [DescribeRules](~~DescribeRules~~) operation to query the IDs of sensitive data detection rules.

parameters.name: RuleName
parameters.description: The name of the sensitive data detection rule that data in the column of the table hits.

parameters.name: SensLevelName
parameters.description:
The name of the sensitivity level of the data that hits the sensitive data detection rule. Valid values:

*   **N/A**: No sensitive data is detected.
*   **S1**: indicates the low sensitivity level.
*   **S2**: indicates the medium sensitivity level.
*   **S3**: indicates the high sensitivity level.
*   **S4**: indicates the highest sensitivity level.

parameters.name: TableId
parameters.description:
The ID of the table to which the column belongs.

> You can call the [DescribeTables](~~DescribeTables~~) operation to query the IDs of tables.

parameters.name: TemplateId
parameters.description:
The ID of the industry-specific classification template.

>  You can call the [DescribeCategoryTemplateList](~~2399296~~) operation to obtain the IDs of industry-specific classification templates.

parameters.name: TemplateRuleId
parameters.description:
The ID of the template rule that is hit.

>  You can call the [DescribeCategoryTemplateRuleList](~~410143~~) operation to obtain the IDs of hit template rules.
